reviews.text: I had searched on line for a four start hotel out side london with a child friendly pool and decided to book this hotel as it seemed very nice in the photo's.
reviews.title: Not Really a four star standard

reviews.text: 1.When booking the package deal on Mercure's own website site it said that we would get a free gift on arrival, That did not happen. Even the girl behind the desk was unaware of such offer.
reviews.title: Perfect!

reviews.text: 2. entering the room and switching on the wall mounted lamp shade, All the lights go out. complained, got the manager around, he goes to fix it in the main fuse room, Bang sparks fly. comes back and say's " He does not want to call the electrician out on a sunday so can we live with the problem with the bulbs taken out. did offer us a the same room on the upper floor but with our child staying with us, declined.
reviews.title: UGHHHH

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 3. No shower gel in the room, even when we asked they said they don't supply, only hair condition was in the room.
reviews.title: three night trip.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel

reviews.text: Stayed at this hotel last night with friends. Handy location for Tunbridge Wells. The rooms were comfortable, clean and spacious. We enjoyed using the pool and steam room - a shame there is no where to relax at the side of the pool . Dinner was excellent and the service at dinner and breakfast was prompt and attentive. We particularly liked Roberto and Jo and enjoyed the warm and light hearted atmosphere they created in the restaurant. We would definitely visit again.
reviews.title: Great overnight stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for 2 nights over a weekend recently. The Ouste part of the hotel is beautiful and very impressive with a very welcoming receptionist. Our room was a disappointment. We had booked a superior which was supposed to have its own lounge area. This actually consisted of 2 small arm chairs 2 feet away from the bed! When my husband enquired if we had e correct room he was assured that this was a superior. We felt like we had been conned into paying quite a lot extra just to have 2 armchairs squeezed into the space. The actual bedroom was decorated beautifully, loved the wallpaper, however, the bathroom had several cracked tiles, mildew around the taps and tiles in the bath area and I kept finding hairs everywhere that weren't mine! We also did not receive our "complimentary" newspaper every morning.
reviews.title: Could do better!

reviews.text: The pool and spa area were tired. The women's changing rooms need a complete refurb. Firstly they are communal which I hate. I am no prude but trying to get changed in a small changing room with 4 other ladies and getting their 'bits' shoved in your face due to lack of space is no fun! When I came out of the pool there were 5 ladies getting changed and there was literally nowhere for me to put my belongings. I got so irritated I went into the only toilet there to change. There seemed to be no heating in this toilet and it was freezing! The pool is very small. The steam room an obvious add on and quite ugly. The jacuzzi was not working. A member of the Spa left for the day when we were leaving and told another member of staff that 'they couldn't wait for to leave for the b###dy day!" I thought this comment was very unprofessional to be made in front of guests regardless how bad her day had been!
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel, brilliant staff

reviews.text: I arrived on a Friday evening for a weekend break. My room was quite far from the main lobby and was, on the whole, quiet and clean.
reviews.title: Nice hotel but avoid the restaurant

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I went for dinner in the restaurant where the head waiter was not at all welcoming and showed us to a table which had not been cleared, then proceeded to spray cleaner which narrowly missed myself and my husband. It was all a bit comical but I was tired from the drive and didn't feel like going into town.
reviews.title: Pleasant break

reviews.text: The plate of marinated olives, rosemary focaccia and walnut bread was nicely presented but expensive at £5.50. My husband's burger was tasty with very nice chips. On the other hand my main course of pasta tagliatelle, mushroom, ricotta and pesto was not great, mostly because the ricotta had been substituted with Gorgonzola without prior warning.
reviews.title: Wonderful service, food and accommodation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The next morning we were met by the same head waiter at breakfast. The restaurant was busy, but not full, with a lot of tables that hadn't been cleared. The buffet selection was average but was not replenished often enough. There was a Spanish waiter who was the only one who seemed welcoming, helpful and efficient. In short the dining room was poorly organised during the two breakfasts that we had and it wasn't a very relaxing way to start the day.
reviews.title: Lovely

reviews.text: This hotel is comfortable and is within easy reach of Tunbridge Wells, but it's really a 3*. I probably wouldn't stay again. I'd rather opt for the personal service one tends to find family-run B&B's.
reviews.title: Valentines deal

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We normally stay at the Holiday Inn at Wrotham, but we decided on this occasion that we would stay at the Mercure in Pembury, mainly for ease of distance to relatives.
reviews.title: Very nice place.

reviews.text: We managed to get a good deal price wise, and as such I was not thinking that we would be getting a good hotel, but, what a surprise, The greeting from the reception staff was very nice, almost as if we were regular known customers, The room was a little bit of a trek along up and down corridors, but once inside we found it to be lovely, no complaints about anything to do with the room, we did have a couple of noisy neighbors, but I managed to sleep through it, my wife tells me that when they returned to the room in the early hours one of them was violently sick, but I didn't hear a thing.
reviews.title: Nice hotel for a short or long weekend

reviews.text: On checking out we were again treated like old friends by the reception staff, namely Vickie.
reviews.title: Clean and comfortable, shame about the food.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Will we stay in this hotel again, the answer is a resounding yes, even though we are platinum priority club members of the Holiday Inn chain.
reviews.title: They did us proud.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We didn't manage to try the leisure facilities, but that may be on another visit.
reviews.title: Excellent Value
